summary:
**Meeting Overview**: The Dallas Environmental Commission will hold a regular meeting on November 13, 2024, at 5:30 p.m. in the Dallas City Hall, 6ES Council Briefing Room, with a videoconference option available. The purpose of the meeting is to discuss environmental initiatives, review past minutes, and address upcoming projects and policies.

**Key Agenda Items**: The agenda includes the approval of minutes from previous meetings, a briefing on the Comprehensive Environmental & Climate Action Plan (CECAP) Annual Report, and a discussion on the Off-Street Parking and Loading Code Amendment.

**Important Details**: Significant proposals include the CECAP Annual Report, which outlines the cityâ€™s progress on climate action initiatives, and the proposed amendment to the Off-Street Parking and Loading Code, aimed at improving urban planning and sustainability. The meeting will also feature updates from various subcommittees focused on environmental health, justice, and outreach.

**Action Items**: The Commission will seek approval for the 2025 Meeting Calendar and will discuss the updates from subcommittees and districts. Public participation is encouraged, with a registration requirement for those wishing to speak. The meeting will conclude with announcements regarding upcoming meetings, including a Parks, Trails, & the Environment Council Committee session on December 2, 2024.
